intro: Connarus allenii, commonly known as the Allen's connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Connarus allenii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
